intro: Renealmia micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered renealmia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. This perennial grass is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit and small, pale green leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of grasses. Renealmia micrantha is often found in wetland or marshy habitats, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
